title.rendered: New report confirms compact foldable for this year

content.rendered:
Reports and information about the foldable Pixel Notepad are now condensing. The new Google phone is expected to appear later this year. The first foldable smartphone has been popping up in the rumor mill for a while now. It didn’t appear last year, but Google probably just postponed it. Insiders are sure that the Pixel Notepad will be presented later this year.

Google is planning a foldable Pixel similar to the Samsung Galaxy Z Fold

Once again someone who is known from the display industry reports. He, Ross Young, says the Google Pixel Notepad is similar to the upcoming Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 4. However, Google relies on a slightly smaller cover display on the outside. There is talk of 5.8 inches, while Samsung is said to be using a screen diagonal of 6.19 inches. The large foldable display on the inside will be somewhere between 7 and 8 inches.

A few days ago there was already a tentative hint of new form factors in the Google Pixel area. Again and again there is talk of a device that will only start in the USA for the time being. Graphics had already appeared in Google’s source codes that would support previous information. And at almost the same time, good sources have informed that Google is said to have chosen “Pixel Notepad” as the name.

Google Pixel Notepad graphic

This is known about the Pixel Notepad so far:

  • Foldable with a large display on the inside
  • Screen diagonal: approx. 6 inches outside, approx. 8 inches inside
  • Price should be below the competition
  • Most likely with Google Tensor
  • Camera probably rather older model

show more

Z Fold 4 and Google foldable will have similar sized foldable displays, but the Google cover display will be quite a bit smaller at 5.8″. This should mean it will have a wider aspect ratio than the Samsung 6.19″ Fold 4. Hear more at our conference next week.

— Ross Young (@DSCCRoss) May 2, 2022
